_header: With this ring I wed thee / and with this gold
Note:
Other manuals have a less rhythmical version of the Pledge; there are many printed Manuals with the tag; a York Manual is printed Henderson (1875)
XHenderson, W. G. Manuale et processionale ad usum insignis ecclesiae Eboracensis
Surtees Society 63 (1875), xvi, 27; and a Welsh Manual, ib.168.
_description: The Marriage Pledge, generally found in most Manuals, in the Ordo ad facienda Sponsalia — in monorhyming lines

CULEe419.Transcription:
Wyth þis ryng I wedde þeAnd wyth þis gold and siluere
                    I honoure þeand wyth þis gyfte I dow þe

CULMm321.Transcription:
With þis ryng ich þe weddeand with my body ich þe
                    honoureand with al my golf iche þe dowe

CamPeter222.Transcription:
Wyth þis ryng y þe weddede& þis gold & seluer
                    y þe ȝeue& wyth my body y þe worschepe& wyth al
                    my wordelyche catel y þe honoure

BLAdd30506.Transcription:
With þis ryng I þe weddeand þis gold and siluer I
                    þe ȝeueand with al myn bodi I the worschepeand with al myn
                    wordlich catel I the honowre

HarWid1.Transcription:
Wyth þis ryng I wed[ ] þeand wyth þis gold and syluere
                    I honour þeand wyth my gyftys I dow þe

YorkMinXVIM4.Transcription:
Wyth þis ryng I wed þeand wyth þis golde and siluer I
                    honor þeand with þis gyfte I dowe þe
YorkMinXVIM4.Editions:
Henderson,  W. G.,
                        ed.  
             Manuale et processionale ad usum insignis ecclesiae Eboracensis
Surtees Society
         63 (1875): xvi, 27.
